segment.source: Generating MBAM 2.5 Stand-alone Reports
segment.target: Generating MBAM 2.5 Stand-alone Reports

segment.source: Generating MBAM 2.5 Stand-alone Reports
segment.target: Generating MBAM 2.5 Stand-alone Reports

segment.source: Generating MBAM 2.5 Stand-alone Reports
segment.target: Generating MBAM 2.5 Stand-alone Reports

segment.source: When you configure Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) with the Stand-alone topology, you can generate reports to monitor BitLocker drive encryption usage and compliance.
segment.target: When you configure Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) with the Stand-alone topology, you can generate reports to monitor BitLocker drive encryption usage and compliance.

segment.source: This topic contains the following procedures:
segment.target: This topic contains the following procedures:

segment.source: To open the Administration and Monitoring Website
segment.target: To open the Administration and Monitoring Website

segment.source: To generate an Enterprise Compliance Report
segment.target: To generate an Enterprise Compliance Report

segment.source: To generate a Computer Compliance Report
segment.target: To generate a Computer Compliance Report

segment.source: To generate a Recovery Key Audit Report
segment.target: To generate a Recovery Key Audit Report

segment.source: For descriptions of the Stand-alone reports, see Understanding MBAM 2.5 Stand-alone Reports.
segment.target: For descriptions of the Stand-alone reports, see Understanding MBAM 2.5 Stand-alone Reports.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To run the reports, you must be a member of the MBAM Report Users group, which you configure in Active Directory Domain Services.
segment.target: To run the reports, you must be a member of the MBAM Report Users group, which you configure in Active Directory Domain Services.

segment.source: For more information, see Planning for MBAM 2.5 Groups and Accounts.
segment.target: For more information, see Planning for MBAM 2.5 Groups and Accounts.

segment.source: To open the Administration and Monitoring Website
segment.target: To open the Administration and Monitoring Website

segment.source: Open a web browser and navigate to the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Open a web browser and navigate to the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: The default URL for the Administration and Monitoring Website is:
segment.target: The default URL for the Administration and Monitoring Website is:

segment.source: http(s)://MBAMAdministrationServerName:port/Helpdesk
segment.target: http(s)://MBAMAdministrationServerName:port/Helpdesk

segment.source: In the left pane, click Reports.
segment.target: In the left pane, click Reports.

segment.source: From the top menu bar, select the report you want to run.
segment.target: From the top menu bar, select the report you want to run.

segment.source: MBAM client data is retained in the Compliance and Audit Database for historical reference in case a computer is lost or stolen.
segment.target: MBAM client data is retained in the Compliance and Audit Database for historical reference in case a computer is lost or stolen.

segment.source: When running enterprise reports, we recommend that you use appropriate start and end dates to scope the time frames for the reports from one to two weeks to increase reporting data accuracy.
segment.target: When running enterprise reports, we recommend that you use appropriate start and end dates to scope the time frames for the reports from one to two weeks to increase reporting data accuracy.

segment.source: After you generate a report, you can save the results in different formats, such as HTML, Microsoft Word, and Microsoft Excel.
segment.target: After you generate a report, you can save the results in different formats, such as HTML, Microsoft Word, and Microsoft Excel.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Configure SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) to use Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) before configuring the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Configure SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) to use Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) before configuring the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: If, for any reason, SSRS is not configured to use SSL, the URL for the Reports will be set to HTTP instead of to HTTPS when you configure the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: If, for any reason, SSRS is not configured to use SSL, the URL for the Reports will be set to HTTP instead of to HTTPS when you configure the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: If you then go to the Administration and Monitoring Website and select a report, the following message displays: “Only Secure Content is Displayed.”
segment.target: If you then go to the Administration and Monitoring Website and select a report, the following message displays: “Only Secure Content is Displayed.”

segment.source: To show the report, click Show All Content.
segment.target: To show the report, click Show All Content.

segment.source: To generate an Enterprise Compliance Report
segment.target: To generate an Enterprise Compliance Report

segment.source: From the Administration and Monitoring Website, select the Reports node from the left navigation pane, select Enterprise Compliance Report, and select the filters that you want to use.
segment.target: From the Administration and Monitoring Website, select the Reports node from the left navigation pane, select Enterprise Compliance Report, and select the filters that you want to use.

segment.source: The available filters for the Enterprise Compliance Report are:
segment.target: The available filters for the Enterprise Compliance Report are:

segment.source: Compliance Status.
segment.target: Compliance Status.

segment.source: Use this filter to specify the compliance status types of the report (for example, Compliant or Noncompliant).
segment.target: Use this filter to specify the compliance status types of the report (for example, Compliant or Noncompliant).

segment.source: Error State.
segment.target: Error State.

segment.source: Use this filter to specify the error state types of the report (for example, No Error or Error).
segment.target: Use this filter to specify the error state types of the report (for example, No Error or Error).

segment.source: Click View Report to display the selected report.
segment.target: Click View Report to display the selected report.

segment.source: Select a computer name to view information about the computer in the Computer Compliance Report.
segment.target: Select a computer name to view information about the computer in the Computer Compliance Report.

segment.source: Select the plus sign (+) next to the computer name to view information about the volumes on the computer.
segment.target: Select the plus sign (+) next to the computer name to view information about the volumes on the computer.

segment.source: To generate a Computer Compliance Report
segment.target: To generate a Computer Compliance Report

segment.source: From the Administration and Monitoring Website, select the Report node from the left navigation pane, and then select Computer Compliance Report.
segment.target: From the Administration and Monitoring Website, select the Report node from the left navigation pane, and then select Computer Compliance Report.

segment.source: Use the Computer Compliance Report to search for User name or Computer name.
segment.target: Use the Computer Compliance Report to search for User name or Computer name.

segment.source: Click View Report to view the Computer Compliance Report.
segment.target: Click View Report to view the Computer Compliance Report.

segment.source: Select a computer name to display more information about the computer in the Computer Compliance Report.
segment.target: Select a computer name to display more information about the computer in the Computer Compliance Report.

segment.source: Select the plus sign (+) next to the computer name to view information about the volumes on the computer.
segment.target: Select the plus sign (+) next to the computer name to view information about the volumes on the computer.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: An MBAM client computer is considered compliant if the computer matches or exceeds the requirements of the MBAM Group Policy settings.
segment.target: An MBAM client computer is considered compliant if the computer matches or exceeds the requirements of the MBAM Group Policy settings.

segment.source: To generate a Recovery Key Audit Report
segment.target: To generate a Recovery Key Audit Report

segment.source: From the Administration and Monitoring Website, select the Report node in the left navigation pane, and then select Recovery Audit Report.
segment.target: From the Administration and Monitoring Website, select the Report node in the left navigation pane, and then select Recovery Audit Report.

segment.source: Select the filters for your Recovery Key Audit Report.
segment.target: Select the filters for your Recovery Key Audit Report.

segment.source: The available filters for recovery key audits are as follows:
segment.target: The available filters for recovery key audits are as follows:

segment.source: Helpdesk User.
segment.target: Helpdesk User.

segment.source: This filter enables users to specify the user name of the requester.
segment.target: This filter enables users to specify the user name of the requester.

segment.source: The requester is the person in the Help Desk who accessed the key on behalf of an end user.
segment.target: The requester is the person in the Help Desk who accessed the key on behalf of an end user.

segment.source: End User.
segment.target: End User.

segment.source: This filter enables users to specify the user name of the requestee.
segment.target: This filter enables users to specify the user name of the requestee.

segment.source: The requestee is the end user who called the Help Desk to obtain a recovery key.
segment.target: The requestee is the end user who called the Help Desk to obtain a recovery key.

segment.source: Request Result.
segment.target: Request Result.

segment.source: This filter enables users to specify the request result types (for example, Success or Failed) that they want to base the report on.
segment.target: This filter enables users to specify the request result types (for example, Success or Failed) that they want to base the report on.

segment.source: For example, users may want to view failed key access attempts.
segment.target: For example, users may want to view failed key access attempts.

segment.source: Key Type.
segment.target: Key Type.

segment.source: This filter enables users to specify the key type (for example, Recovery Key Password or TPM Password Hash) that they want to base the report on.
segment.target: This filter enables users to specify the key type (for example, Recovery Key Password or TPM Password Hash) that they want to base the report on.

segment.source: Start Date.
segment.target: Start Date.

segment.source: This filter is used to define the Start Date part of the date range that the user wants to report on.
segment.target: This filter is used to define the Start Date part of the date range that the user wants to report on.

segment.source: End Date.
segment.target: End Date.

segment.source: This filter is used to define the End Date part of the date range that the users want to report on.
segment.target: This filter is used to define the End Date part of the date range that the users want to report on.

segment.source: Click View Report to view the report.
segment.target: Click View Report to view the report.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for MBAM?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for MBAM?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: Got a MBAM issue?
segment.target: Got a MBAM issue?

segment.source: Use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
segment.target: Use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
